content:
Based on the provided web search results, Facebook is the most popular social media platform for the age group of 35-50, followed by YouTube and Instagram. According to a survey by Pew Research Center, 77% of people aged 30 to 49, which falls within the 35-50 age range, use Facebook [1]. Another survey by the same organization reveals that 71% of adults in the Gen X age group, which includes people aged 35-50, use Facebook daily [4]. This is also supported by a study which reports that nearly 80% of 30- to 49-year-olds use social media, with Facebook being the most popular [6].

It's worth noting that YouTube is also popular among this age group. According to Pew Research Center, 63% of people aged 35-44 and 61% of people aged 45-54 use YouTube [2]. Moreover, the Gen X age group spends the most time on YouTube compared to other social media platforms [4].

Instagram is also used by a significant proportion of people aged 35-50, with 43% of 30-49 year-olds and 34% of 50-64 year-olds using the platform [2].

In summary, Facebook is the most popular social media platform for the age group of 35-50, followed by YouTube and Instagram.
